intro: Erodium praecox var. albomaculatum, commonly known as the white-spotted stork's bill, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Leguminosae family, characterized by its small, pea-like flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 20–40 cm and produces small, bean-like pods that contain several seeds. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color, with white spots that give it its common name. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
